content.title: AAA Surveillance
content.definition: Surveillance intervals: <4cm every 2-3 years, 4-4.4cm annually, 4.5-5.4cm every 6 months.
content.statement: AAA Surveillance is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Aaa that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding AAA Surveillance helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of AAA Surveillance include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of AAA Surveillance.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
